moves.2. Nf3: Not as sharp as 2. c4, but perfectly playable
moves.2... g6: So I continue with my development.
moves.3... Bg7: I protect it with my Bishop
moves.4... d5: I could easily play d7-d6 with a view to transposing into the Pirc-Modern defence, but this seems better...
moves.5. h3: This seems a waste of time to me
moves.5... c5: So hit the centre, or center for our American friends....
moves.6. Qd2: This seems another lemon, allowing me to play....
moves.6... Ne4: Hitting the queen. I think Qf4 is best now
moves.11. b3: Protecting a2, but leaving horrible weak dark squares his king
moves.11... Qc5: Stopping c3 or e3 but Qr5 may be even stronger?
moves.13... Nc6: with potential attacks on the king, for instance 14. e3? Qa3 followed by Nb4
moves.14. g4: As e3 is prevented, he tries to develop his bishop to g2.
moves.14... f5: Solidifying the centre, making sure his Bg2 will do nothing....
moves.15... Nb4: Black resigns. The position is still playable, but Ra-c8 is also in the air, ganging up on c2, and maybe e4-e3 is some variations. Thank you for reading.
